etymology.description: 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") + 音(音) (yīn, "sound") = mouth making sound -> to speak slowly
etymology.interpretation: The character combines 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth"), which indicates the action of speaking, with 音(音) (yīn, "sound"), suggesting speaking. Together, they convey the idea of speaking deliberately or slowly.
